title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 825.4 - Special conditions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 825.4 - Special conditions

State Regulations
(a) All
streams or other bodies of water which appear as black lines with accompanying
waters index numbers on the reference maps herein, or which appear as blue
continuous or dotted lines to indicate natural waters on the original published
maps listed above, and which natural waters are not specifically designated in
table I, shall be assigned the same classes and standards of quality and purity
as the specifically designated waters to which they are directly
tributary. (b) All streams, rivulets, and other collections of natural surface waters within the basins as
above defined, which waters are not shown on the original published maps listed
above, shall be assigned to class D with standards of quality and purity for
class D assigned thereto; provided, however, that any continuous flowing
natural stream which is not shown on the reference maps shall have the same
classification and assigned standards as the waters to which it is directly
tributary. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
825.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
